models – core¶

class djangoerp.core.models.Group(*args, **kwargs)[código fonte]¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.models.Group

A proxy for Group model which customize its string representation.

exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.models.DoesNotExist

args¶
message¶
silent_variable_failure = True¶
exception Group.MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.models.MultipleObjectsReturned

args¶
message¶
Group.check(**kwargs)¶
Group.clean()¶

Hook for doing any extra model-wide validation after clean() has been called on every field by self.clean_fields. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field defined by NON_FIELD_ERRORS.

Group.clean_fields(exclude=None)¶

Cleans all fields and raises a ValidationError containing a dict of all validation errors if any occur.

Group.date_error_message(lookup_type, field_name, unique_for)¶
Group.delete(using=None)¶
Group.from_db(db, field_names, values)¶
Group.full_clean(exclude=None, validate_unique=True)¶

Calls clean_fields, clean, and validate_unique, on the model, and raises a ValidationError for any errors that occurred.

Group.get_deferred_fields()¶

Returns a set containing names of deferred fields for this instance.

Group.natural_key()[código fonte]¶
Group.objectpermissions¶
Group.objects = <django.contrib.auth.models.GroupManager object>¶
Group.permissions¶
Group.pk¶
Group.prepare_database_save(field)¶
Group.refresh_from_db(using=None, fields=None, **kwargs)¶

Reloads field values from the database.

By default, the reloading happens from the database this instance was loaded from, or by the read router if this instance wasn’t loaded from any database. The using parameter will override the default.

Fields can be used to specify which fields to reload. The fields should be an iterable of field attnames. If fields is None, then all non-deferred fields are reloaded.

When accessing deferred fields of an instance, the deferred loading of the field will call this method.

Group.save(force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)¶

Saves the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

Group.save_base(raw=False, force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)¶

Handles the parts of saving which should be done only once per save, yet need to be done in raw saves, too. This includes some sanity checks and signal sending.

The ‘raw’ argument is telling save_base not to save any parent models and not to do any changes to the values before save. This is used by fixture loading.

Group.serializable_value(field_name)¶

Returns the value of the field name for this instance. If the field is a foreign key, returns the id value, instead of the object. If there’s no Field object with this name on the model, the model attribute’s value is returned directly.

Used to serialize a field’s value (in the serializer, or form output, for example). Normally, you would just access the attribute directly and not use this method.

Group.unique_error_message(model_class, unique_check)¶
Group.user_set¶
Group.validate_unique(exclude=None)¶

Checks unique constraints on the model and raises ValidationError if any failed.

User.REQUIRED_FIELDS = [u'email']¶

User.check_password(raw_password)¶

Returns a boolean of whether the raw_password was correct. Handles hashing formats behind the scenes.

Hook for doing any extra model-wide validation after clean() has been called on every field by self.clean_fields. Any ValidationError raised by this method will not be associated with a particular field; it will have a special-case association with the field defined by NON_FIELD_ERRORS.

Cleans all fields and raises a ValidationError containing a dict of all validation errors if any occur.

User.get_absolute_url(*args, **kwargs)[código fonte]¶
User.get_all_permissions(obj=None)¶
User.get_deferred_fields()¶

Returns a set containing names of deferred fields for this instance.

User.get_full_name()[código fonte]¶
User.get_group_permissions(obj=None)¶

Returns a list of permission strings that this user has through their groups. This method queries all available auth backends. If an object is passed in, only permissions matching this object are returned.

User.get_language_display(*moreargs, **morekwargs)¶
User.get_next_by_date_joined(*moreargs, **morekwargs)¶
User.get_previous_by_date_joined(*moreargs, **morekwargs)¶
User.get_session_auth_hash()¶

Returns an HMAC of the password field.

User.get_short_name()[código fonte]¶
User.get_timezone_display(*moreargs, **morekwargs)¶
User.get_username()¶

Return the identifying username for this User

User.groups¶
User.has_module_perms(app_label)¶

Returns True if the user has any permissions in the given app label. Uses pretty much the same logic as has_perm, above.

User.has_perm(perm, obj=None)¶

Returns True if the user has the specified permission. This method queries all available auth backends, but returns immediately if any backend returns True. Thus, a user who has permission from a single auth backend is assumed to have permission in general. If an object is provided, permissions for this specific object are checked.

User.has_perms(perm_list, obj=None)¶

Returns True if the user has each of the specified permissions. If object is passed, it checks if the user has all required perms for this object.

User.has_usable_password()¶
User.is_active = True¶
User.is_anonymous()¶

Always returns False. This is a way of comparing User objects to anonymous users.

User.is_authenticated()¶

Always return True. This is a way to tell if the user has been authenticated in templates.

User.natural_key()¶
User.objectpermissions¶
User.objects = <djangoerp.core.managers.UserManager object>¶
User.pk¶
User.prepare_database_save(field)¶
User.refresh_from_db(using=None, fields=None, **kwargs)¶

Reloads field values from the database.

By default, the reloading happens from the database this instance was loaded from, or by the read router if this instance wasn’t loaded from any database. The using parameter will override the default.

Fields can be used to specify which fields to reload. The fields should be an iterable of field attnames. If fields is None, then all non-deferred fields are reloaded.

When accessing deferred fields of an instance, the deferred loading of the field will call this method.

User.save(force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)¶

Saves the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

User.save_base(raw=False, force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)¶

Handles the parts of saving which should be done only once per save, yet need to be done in raw saves, too. This includes some sanity checks and signal sending.

The ‘raw’ argument is telling save_base not to save any parent models and not to do any changes to the values before save. This is used by fixture loading.

User.serializable_value(field_name)¶

Returns the value of the field name for this instance. If the field is a foreign key, returns the id value, instead of the object. If there’s no Field object with this name on the model, the model attribute’s value is returned directly.

Used to serialize a field’s value (in the serializer, or form output, for example). Normally, you would just access the attribute directly and not use this method.

User.set_password(raw_password)¶
User.set_unusable_password()¶

User.user_permissions¶
User.validate_unique(exclude=None)¶

Checks unique constraints on the model and raises ValidationError if any failed.

Reloads field values from the database.

By default, the reloading happens from the database this instance was loaded from, or by the read router if this instance wasn’t loaded from any database. The using parameter will override the default.

Saves the current instance. Override this in a subclass if you want to control the saving process.

The ‘force_insert’ and ‘force_update’ parameters can be used to insist that the “save” must be an SQL insert or update (or equivalent for non-SQL backends), respectively. Normally, they should not be set.

ObjectPermission.save_base(raw=False, force_insert=False, force_update=False, using=None, update_fields=None)

Handles the parts of saving which should be done only once per save, yet need to be done in raw saves, too. This includes some sanity checks and signal sending.
